channel.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
channel.description:
I want to be able to use commands like ::pickup and ::bank but it wont let me. My account info is set to Admin.
Any help?

@jadedt wrote:

yea thanks

Read full topic
item.source: How do I allow myself to use Commands?

item.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Your Master, post:22, topic:262058”]go on client.java that called: ‘‘Client’’ in your server files. Then press CTRL + B type that command like banuser then there is called playerrights > 2
That means only admin or higher rank can ban. But to make Mod can ban remove that 2, and write in 1
Then Mods can ban or higher rank. Easy dude, you need to learn more about Java, Coding & adding.[/quote]

[Player Rights]
[Who can do it]

playerRights > 0

Moderator, Administrator, Owner, Hidden

playerRights >= 0

Player, Moderator, Administrator, Owner, Hidden

playerRights > 1

Administrator, Owner, Hidden

playerRights >= 1

Moderator, Administrator, Owner, Hidden

playerRights > 2

Owner, Hidden

playerRights > =2

Administrator, Owner, Hidden

playerRights > 3

Hidden

playerRights >= 3

Owner, Hidden

playerRights == 0

Normal Player

playerRights == 1

Moderator

playerRights == 2

Administrator

playerRights == 3

Owner

playerRights == 4

Hidden

Understand now?

Read full topic

item.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
item.dc:creator: @Your_Master Your Master
item.description:
@Your_Master wrote:

go on client.java that called: ‘‘Client’’ in your server files. Then press CTRL + B type that command like banuser then there is called playerrights > 2
That means only admin or higher rank can ban. But to make Mod can ban remove that 2, and write in 1
Then Mods can ban or higher rank. Easy dude, you need to learn more about Java, Coding & adding.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
item.dc:creator: @oldschoolscape oldschoolscape
item.description:
@oldschoolscape wrote:

jc22493:

[quote]playerRights > 0){

That means that if your player rights are MORE THAN 0, then the command will proceed.
0 = Normal Player
1 = Moderator
2 = Administrator
3 = High Administrator/Owner[/quote]

thanks so thats everyone above a normal player, if i wanted it too just be owner then id have too change it completely as playerRights > 3){ means everyone over owner ? if i find a command thats just for owners in my client.java and i just change the symbols around the player rights bit i should be ok ?

Read full topic

what does the quoted part mean? if i change that too a 3 does that mean only i can do it?

try ::pick 746 1

item.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 2) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("You aren't allowed to spawn items."); } }[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 14, 2009, 08:14:01 am[/size][hr][quote=“jadedt, post:15, topic:262058”][code] if (command.startsWith(“pick”) && (playerRights >= 3)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("You typed it wrong. ;)");[/code]

I get that error… You typed it wrong (Ingame)

This is the thing i type in game:

::pickup 1 1

As you can see, your command is “pick”, not “pickup”.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
item.dc:creator: @jadedt jadedt
item.description:
@jadedt wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pick”) && (playerRights >= 3)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("You typed it wrong. ;)");[/code]

I get that error… You typed it wrong (Ingame)

This is the thing i type in game:

::pickup 1 1

item.source: How do I allow myself to use Commands?

item.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“jadedt, post:12, topic:262058”]if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equals("S00nerfan"))) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("You aren't allowed to spawn items."); } }

This?[/quote]

Just remove the player name requirement.

if (command.startsWith("pickup")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("You aren't allowed to spawn items."); } }

Read full topic
item.source: How do I allow myself to use Commands?

item.title: How do I allow myself to use Commands?
item.dc:creator: @Backlash Backlash
item.description:
@Backlash wrote:

[quote=“jadedt, post:12, topic:262058”]if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerName.equals("S00nerfan"))) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("You aren't allowed to spawn items."); } }

This?[/quote]

Change S00nerfan to your in-game name. That should do it.
